reference.title: Frequently Asked Questions
reference.shortdesc: Frequently asked questions about the upgrade.

ol.li:
How are data sources handled in SiteCatalyst 15?
Data sources behave differently based on the source type:
Full processing, web log, and transaction ID data sources appear as normal. When segments are applied, the data is filtered according to the segment rules.
Standard or conversion data sources (ad campaigns, CRM, customer satisfaction, site performance, generic summary data, online purchases, leads and quotes, and offline channel data) appear in SiteCatalyst 15. However, because those data sources are not tied to visits or visitors, they are filtered out when segments are applied.
Traffic data sources (Website Usage > Traffic Data Source) do not appear in SiteCatalyst 15.
You can identify whether a report suite has a traffic data source by going to Admin > Data Sources and looking for an entry showing “Type: Traffic Data Source,” like this:

Can ReportBuilder and ExcelClient access SiteCatalyst 15?
Yes. However, new features such as segmentation, and new metrics such as Unique Visitors, are not available to ExcelClient. ReportBuilder 4.2, released in October 2011, supports all SiteCatalyst 15 features.

Will SiteCatalyst reporting APIs have access to SiteCatalyst 15?
Yes. Segmentation via the API is fully supported as of October 2011.

How many times a day is data updated? Is the update on a batch process or real time? How real time is real time?
Though the Marketing Cloud's platform is robust, there are a few situations that may lead to delays in reporting.
See Latency Troubleshooting in the Analytics Reference guide.

Do I need to retag my site to use SiteCatalyst 15?
No, with the exception of your video implementation. If you are not tracking video, there is no need to update your JavaScript or other AppMeasurement libraries.

Why do I need Discover, if I can create segments in SiteCatalyst?
SiteCatalyst is ideal for broadly disseminating data across an organization. Discover is ideal for deep, fast, effective analysis of online data. The two products complement each other and deliver a powerful online analytic solution. With rare exceptions, analysts who use Discover and upgraded to SiteCatalyst 15 have indicated that they still need Discover to maintain their level of efficiency.

Will there be an s_code update required to leverage the s.contextData variables?
Yes. H.23 or later supports contextData variables. This file can be downloaded in the Admin Console.
